name: 360 Push Up
description: Explosive plyometric push-up where you launch off the floor and rotate 360° in the air before landing back into the next rep. Extremely advanced; prioritize safe landing and shoulder integrity.

name: Advanced Tuck Planche
description: Isometric planche progression with knees close to chest but hips opened relative to shoulders. Shoulders protracted and wrists under or slightly behind hips.

name: Arch Hold
description: Prone posterior-chain hold: squeeze glutes, lift chest, arms, and thighs off the floor while keeping neck neutral. The opposite of a hollow hold.

name: Archer Pull Up
description: Unilateral pull-up variation: pull toward one hand while the opposite arm remains extended, shifting most load to one side. Alternate sides each rep.

name: Archer Push Up
description: Wide asymmetric push-up: one arm bends while the other remains extended, shifting most of the load to the bent side. Progression toward one-arm push-ups.

name: Back Lever
description: Isometric hold on rings or bar with body facing down, hips extended, and shoulders in full extension. Keep a posterior pelvic tilt to protect the lower back.

name: Back Roll to Handstand
description: Gymnastics skill: from a squat or pike, roll backward onto shoulders and use momentum plus a press to arrive in a handstand with locked elbows.

name: Bar Kips
description: Dynamic beat/kipping swing on a bar generating momentum to transition from hang to support on top of the bar. Keep hollow↔arch rhythm tight.

name: Cartwheel
description: Lateral acrobatic move: place hands sequentially on the floor and rotate the body sideways, landing on the opposite foot. Emphasizes spatial awareness and shoulder loading.

name: Clap Push Up
description: Plyometric push-up exploding off the floor to clap hands before returning to the ground. Land softly with elbows slightly bent.

name: Crow Pose
description: Arm-balance with knees resting high on triceps, elbows bent, and shoulders protracted. Look slightly forward to maintain balance.

name: Diamond Push Up
description: Close-grip push-up with hands under the sternum forming a diamond shape. Increases triceps and sternal-pec demand.

name: Dragon Flag
description: Advanced core lever made famous by Bruce Lee: from shoulders-on-bench position, keep body rigid as you lower and raise as one unit without hip break.

name: Elbow Lever
description: Prone-facing balance with elbows resting on abdomen/hips and hands on the floor; body held parallel to the ground.

name: Elbow Stand
description: Forearm-supported inversion (pincha mayurasana). Shoulders stacked over elbows with active scapular elevation and a neutral ribcage.

name: Explosive Pull Up
description: Power pull-up aiming to pull the bar to chest or lower sternum. Useful for muscle-up preparation.

name: Freestanding Handstand Push Up
description: Strict handstand push-up performed without wall support. Requires balance plus overhead pressing strength.

name: Front Lever
description: Isometric hold on rings or bar with body facing up, hips extended, and torso parallel to ground. Maintain hollow body and shoulder depression.

name: Front Lever Pull Up
description: Pull-ups performed while holding a front lever body line. Small ROM counts—quality before quantity.

name: Handstand
description: Inversion balanced on hands with elbows locked, shoulders elevated, ribs stacked, and posterior pelvic tilt. Practice against a wall before freestanding.

name: Handstand Push Up
description: Vertical pressing in a handstand, typically performed against a wall for stability. Aim for full ROM: head to floor and lockout.

name: Hindu Push Up
description: Dynamic push-up flowing from downward dog to cobra and back. Promotes shoulder mobility and scapular control.

name: Hollow Body Hold
description: Supine isometric: ribs down, lower back pressed to floor, legs and shoulders slightly lifted, arms by ears. Maintain constant tension.

name: Human Flag
description: Sideways isometric on a vertical pole with body parallel to ground. Emphasize shoulder depression and rib-to-pelvis oblique connection.

name: L-Sit
description: Compression hold supporting body on hands with legs straight at ~90° hip flexion. Keep shoulders depressed and quads locked.

name: Manna
description: An elite static compression hold (floor or parallettes) where the hips lift well behind the hands and the shoulders move into deep extension; the terminal step of the L-Sit → V-Sit progression.

name: Mike Tyson Push Up
description: Pike push-up variant: start with feet close to hands, shift hips forward as you lower to bring chin near floor, then push back to pike.

name: Muscle Up
description: Explosive pull-up transitioning to a dip to arrive above the rings or bar. Keep a tight false grip on rings or use a dynamic kip on bar.

name: One Arm-hang
description: Passive or active hang from one arm on a bar or rings. Build time gradually to protect elbows and shoulders.

name: One Arm Pull Up
description: Strict vertical pull using a single arm. Often trained via rope assist or archer progressions before true one-arm reps.

name: One Arm Elbow Lever
description: Single-arm variation of the elbow lever with the torso balanced on one elbow/forearm. Requires strong wrist and core control.

name: Planche
description: Elite isometric with body parallel to floor supported only by hands. Scapular protraction and posterior pelvic tilt are non‑negotiable.

name: Planche Push Up
description: Push-ups performed while holding a planche body line. Micro-range reps are acceptable initially.

name: Press Handstand
description: From standing or straddle, compress hips and press the feet off the floor to handstand without a jump. Emphasizes scapular elevation and compression.

name: Push Up
description: Standard floor push-up with straight body line, elbows ~45° from torso, and full lockout at top.

name: Skin the Cat
description: On rings or bar, rotate through the shoulders from hang to a full German hang and return. Trains shoulder extension and core control.

name: Straddle Planche
description: Planche with legs straddled to reduce leverage. Maintain protraction and PPT.

name: Tuck Planche
description: Entry-level planche progression with knees tucked to reduce leverage, arms straight, and shoulders protracted.

name: Typewriter Pull Up
description: At the top of a wide pull-up, shift your chin horizontally from one hand to the other before lowering. Builds unilateral lat strength.

name: V-Sit
description: Advanced compression hold with legs above hip height in a V shape. Requires strong hip flexors and hamstring flexibility.

name: Wall Handstand
description: Handstand held with assistance from a wall (belly-to-wall or back-to-wall). Focus on stacked alignment and active shoulders.

name: Wall Handstand Push Up
description: Handstand push-up performed with heels touching a wall for balance. Train full ROM when possible.

name: Wall-supported L-Sit
description: Assisted L-sit with back lightly touching a wall or using low parallettes for support. Useful for building compression time.

name: Wide Push Up
description: Push-up with hands set wider than shoulder-width to emphasize pectorals and reduce triceps contribution.

name: Diamond Push Ups
description: A bodyweight exercise performed by lowering and raising the body using the arms while keeping the body straight. Variations target different parts of the chest, shoulders, and triceps.

name: Archer Push Ups
description: A bodyweight exercise performed by lowering and raising the body using the arms while keeping the body straight. Variations target different parts of the chest, shoulders, and triceps.

name: Shoulder Taps
description: From high plank, tap the opposite shoulder while resisting hip sway (anti-rotation). Move slow to increase difficulty.

name: Plank Arm Reach
description: From high plank, extend one arm forward without shifting the torso. Squeeze glutes and quads to keep pelvis level.

name: Side Plank Raises
description: From side plank, lower hips toward the floor and lift back to neutral. Keep shoulder stacked over elbow.

name: Side Plank
description: Static side-lying plank on forearm and edge of foot with a straight line from head to heels.

name: Plank
description: High plank on hands with straight body line, active shoulders, and posterior pelvic tilt.

name: Low Plank
description: Forearm plank variant. Elbows under shoulders, forearms parallel, ribs down, and glutes engaged.

name: Planche Lean
description: Lean the shoulders forward over the wrists in a straight-arm plank to overload shoulder flexion and build planche-specific strength.

name: Pseudo Planche Push Up
description: Push-up with hands turned out and placed lower/closer to hips with a forward lean to increase shoulder flexion demands. Planche prep.

name: Head to Bar
description: High pull-up drill pulling until the bar touches or nearly touches the forehead. Control the descent.

name: Head Above Bar
description: High pull-up targeting chest-to-bar height; strive to bring sternum to the bar with an aggressive pull.

name: Pull Up
description: Pronated-grip pull-up from a dead hang until chin clears the bar, finishing with elbows down and shoulder blades depressed.

name: Supinated Pull Up
description: Underhand (chin-up) pull emphasizing biceps while still engaging lats. Keep ribs down and avoid excessive lumbar arch.

name: Mike Tyson Push Ups
description: A bodyweight exercise performed by lowering and raising the body using the arms while keeping the body straight. Variations target different parts of the chest, shoulders, and triceps.

name: 3-5-7s
description: Isometric ladder protocol: hold bottom, mid, and top positions of a chosen exercise for 3s/5s/7s respectively. One 'rep' completes all three holds.

name: Tiger Push Ups
description: Tiger bend push-up: start on forearms (tripod), press to hands, then lower back to forearms. Builds triceps and anterior delts.

name: Walk Outs and Back
description: From standing, hinge to place hands on floor, walk to a high plank, then walk back to stand. Keep core tight to avoid lumbar sway.

name: Walk Outs
description: Inchworm-style drill: hinge, walk hands forward to high plank, pause briefly, then walk hands back and stand tall.

name: Superman
description: Prone hold lifting arms and legs off the floor to strengthen spinal extensors. Keep glutes tight and neck neutral.

name: Star Superman
description: Wide-stance/prone variation of the superman with arms and legs abducted into a star shape. Emphasizes posterior chain endurance.

name: Jump Squat
description: Bodyweight squat into an explosive vertical jump. Land softly and immediately descend into the next rep (stick and go).

name: Bicycle Crunches
description: Alternating elbow‑to‑opposite‑knee crunch with an extended leg hovering off the floor. Keep lower back pressed down.

name: Windshield Wiper
description: Supine or hanging variation in which legs sweep side to side like wipers. Keep shoulders pinned and control the eccentric.

name: Wide Pull Up
description: Pull-up with a wider-than-shoulder grip to increase lat and teres major involvement; slightly reduced ROM at the top.

name: Opposite Arm & Leg Extensions
description: Prone 'swimmer' alternation: lift opposite arm and leg off the floor simultaneously, then switch sides in rhythm.

name: Full Body Extensions
description: Prone dynamic extension lifting arms and legs off the floor together, then lowering under control.

name: Handstand on Blocks (Facing Up)
description: Handstand performed with hands elevated on blocks (palms on top). Increases wrist ROM and balance challenge.

name: Handstand on Blocks (Facing Down)
description: Handstand on blocks gripping the front edge (fingers down). Adds range and a different balance feel.

name: Wall Handstand Hold
description: Timed wall-assisted handstand emphasizing stacked alignment and shoulder elevation.

name: Wall Handstand Walkouts
description: From a wall handstand, carefully walk your hands away from the wall and then back to develop scapular control and midline stability.

name: Knee Raises
description: Hanging knee raises: from a dead hang, posteriorly tilt pelvis and lift knees toward chest without swinging.

name: Shorties
description: Seated compression pulses: with hands by hips and legs straight, lift heels a few centimeters off the floor for reps. Keep knees locked.

name: Kettlebell Swings
description: Hip-hinge ballistic swing from between the legs to roughly chest height (hard-style). Drive with hips, not arms.

name: Kettlebell Raises
description: Front or lateral shoulder raises with kettlebells performed strictly without body English.

name: Kettlebell Lifts
description: General strength lifts with kettlebells (e.g., clean, press) performed in controlled fashion. Select loads conservatively.

name: Iron Cross with Kettlebells
description: Static lateral arm hold at ~90° abduction while holding kettlebells. Mimics ring iron cross loading pattern for the shoulders.

name: Figure Eight
description: Pass the kettlebell in a figure‑8 pattern between the legs using a strong hinge and neutral spine. Keep the bell close to the body.

name: Band Opposite Arm-Leg Pull
description: Anti-rotation core drill using a resistance band: pull with one arm while extending the opposite leg, resisting trunk twist.
